# fivbvis

<!-- badges: start -->
[![Lifecycle: experimental](https://img.shields.io/badge/lifecycle-experimental-orange.svg)](https://www.tidyverse.org/lifecycle/#experimental)
![openvolley](https://img.shields.io/badge/openvolley-darkblue.svg?logo=data:image/svg%2bxml;base64,)
[![R-CMD-check](https://github.com/openvolley/fivbvis/workflows/R-CMD-check/badge.svg)](https://github.com/openvolley/fivbvis/actions)
<!-- badges: end -->

fivbvis provides an R client to the [FIVB VIS web service system](https://www.fivb.org/VisSDK/VisWebService/#Introduction.html).

## Installation

You can install fivbvis with:

``` r
options(repos = c(openvolley = "https://openvolley.r-universe.dev",
                  CRAN = "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

install.packages("fivbvis")

## or

install.packages("remotes") ## if needed
remotes::install_github("openvolley/fivbvis")
```

## Examples

By default, results are cached in a per-session cache, so if we make the same request again the local results are used, rather than re-downloading.

### 1. Tournaments List

```{r ex1, eval = FALSE}
library(fivbvis)
all_tournaments <- v_get_volley_tournament_list()
nrow(all_tournaments)

```

```{r ex1hidden, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
## extra code to make sure that the README renders as if it was started in a fresh session each time
library(fivbvis)
v_options(verbose = FALSE)
chd <- tempfile()
dir.create(chd)
v_cache_dir(chd)
all_tournaments <- v_get_volley_tournament_list()
nrow(all_tournaments)

```

### 2. Tournaments List with Filter

```{r ex1b}
t2021 <- v_get_volley_tournament_list(children = list(Filter = c(Seasons = "2021")))
t2021$name

```

### 3. Tournament Details

Get details for a specific tournament:

```{r ex2}
v_get_volley_tournament(1)

```


## Troubleshooting

Known issues:

### `internal error: Huge input lookup`

This indicates that the XML response from the FIVB server is too large or deeply nested and is causing the parser to fail. By default the parser restricts the nesting level that it allows, in order to prevent crashes or other undesirable behaviour. But you can remove this restriction by:

```{r eval = FALSE}
v_options(huge_xml = TRUE)
```

and then try your request again.
